Description:
ReliefWeb, a specialized digital service of the United Nations Office of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), is a source for timely information on global crises and disasters, enabling humanitarians to make informed decisions and plan effective assistance. Content (including that related to COVID-19) on this site including the latest reports, maps, and infographics from trusted sources, is delivered through the API.
The ReliefWeb API provides developer-friendly access to content on the ReliefWeb site. ReliefWeb launched in 1996 and has been posting Reports continuously since. Also available are UN reports on major disasters from the 1980s. Data in updated is real-time.
